title: Cryptoworldman
author: Cryptoworldman
content: Hey I'm a bitcointlk managerDo you want to promote your project through  bitcointlk Bounty program?

comments.author: shasan
comments.body: Quote from: Cryptoworldman on June 01, 2022, 12:26:41 PMHey I'm a bitcointlk managerDo you want to promote your project through  bitcointlk Bounty program?Welcome to the managing service. But before providing a service you should concentrate on what you are writing on the forum. You have introduced as a bitcointalk manager where you should say Bounty Campaign Manager, Bounty Manager, Signature Campaign Manager or something like that. Along with these you should provide as many information as possible base on your service.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: Cryptoworldman on June 01, 2022, 12:26:41 PMHey I'm a bitcointlk managerDo you want to promote your project through  bitcointlk Bounty program?I believe you should first gain some reputation on the forum before offering management services. You are still a newbie with less than 5 days of activity on the forum. You cannot even post pictures on the forum with your current rank, so how will you post ANNs or service topics?

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: Quote from: Cryptoworldman on June 01, 2022, 12:26:41 PMHey I'm a bitcointlk managerDo you want to promote your project through  bitcointlk Bounty program?You should really try and take the time to pay someone to make a proper introduction thread for your service or if you know how to do it yourself you should. Being a newbie you will have to work alot harder to get jobs, so while you have time on your hands you should do as I suggested.

comments.author: LTU_btc
comments.body: If I would have business which would need some promotion, I definitely would hire random newbie without experience than experienced manager with good reputation. C'mon, you didn't even made proper ANN, wait, you didn't even checked spelling before posting and wrote bitcointlk twice. No offence OP, but it's not professional.You can follow suggestion give by yahoo above, but I suggest to look for other business ideas. We have more than enough established managers on Bitcointalk, probably more than available campaigns. So, IMO, there isn't much perspective for new managers.
